title: CPKC set for another first as KC Current prepares for Women Cup match
body_text:
CPKC set for another first as KC Current prepares for Women’s Cup match
KANSAS CITY, Mo. (KCTV) - CPKC Stadium is set for another first - Kansas City’s first Women’s Cup championship matches featuring the KC Current.
CPKC Stadium - the first stadium built just for women’s soccer - announced on Friday, May 10, that it will welcome some of the world’s best teams as the Women’s World Cup makes its debut in the heartland.
“CPKC Stadium will be an incredible place to expand The Women’s Cup in the USA,” said JP Reynal, TWC chief executive officer. “Women’s football is growing across the globe and we are excited to bring the world’s best together to compete and showcase the beautiful game.”
Stadium officials noted that the four-team tournament will be held Aug. 14 and 17 with hosts, the Kansas City Current, 2023 African Champion Mamelodi Sundowns, 2023 Copa de la Reina Champion Atlético de Madrid and Japanese powerhouse INAC Kobe Leonessa.
“We are excited to welcome the world to CPKC Stadium,” said Kansas City Current President Raven Jemison. “We have opened the stadium to sold-out crowds and incredibly exciting football, and we can’t wait to host these world-class teams in Kansas City and show them why we are the Soccer Capital of America.”
Officials noted that the KC tournament is the second TWC USA tournament in 2024 - just after the Louisville edition. Both tournaments are set to feature a $100,000 prize pool.
The tournament is set to open with Atlético and INAC Kobe at 5 p.m. on Aug. 14. The Current will face off with the Sundowns at 8 p.m. The winners will play for the Championship at 8 p.m. on Aug. 17. The consolation match will preview at 5 p.m.
Tournament officials indicated that the 2024 U.S. tournaments are part of the new TWC Global Series, played in different locations. Champions of each event will be invited to the Global Series Finals in February at a site that has yet to be announced.
